meta-review.comment:
Hippo Penny, folks! I'm back with another groovy review, and this time, I'm folding my way through the whimsical world of Paper Trail!

As a seasoned (get it? like paper?) critic, I've got to say that this game has me hooked. The art is straight-up gorgeous, like something you'd find in a mystical fairy tale (or an Instagram filter). But what really gets me folding is the puzzle mechanic! It's like they took all my favorite origami techniques and wrapped them up into bite-sized brain-twisters.

Now, I know what you're thinking: "Is it too cute?" Well, let's just say that while some critics might find it a tad...twee...I'm all about embracing the whimsy. And honestly, who doesn't love a good paper-folding pun?

But in all seriousness, the developers at [insert dev studio] have done an amazing job of balancing charm and complexity. The puzzles are clever without being frustratingly hard, making it perfect for puzzle fans like me (and maybe even my fellow critics...ahem, Push Square).

So, what's the verdict? Well, I'm not one to dish out scores (unless you're asking me to review a pizza... then we can get into some serious talk), but let's just say that Paper Trail has earned a spot in my top-shelf puzzle games. The story might not be the most emotionally resonant, but who cares when you've got a world of paper folding and sliding to keep you company?

Farewell, friends! Until next time, when I'll be diving into another groovy game...
